record.author: Maganga and Schadeberg 1992
record.notes: Data from Maganga and Schadeberg 1992 : Kinyamwezi grammar, texts, vocabulary. Rüdiger Köppe Verlag, Köln
record.classification: Niger-Congo, Atlantic-Congo, Volta-Congo, Benue-Congo, Bantoid, Southern, Narrow Bantu, Central, F, Sukuma-Nyamwezi (F.20)

record.annotation: dry: become (as when a drum gains its normal pitch after being warmed up in the sun or by a fire)
dry: become (of green vegetables), heal (of wound)
beer to which sugar or honey has been added
beer without sugar or honey added

record.french: porter un enfant sur le dos

record.annotation: cut (with sharp instrument); become bitter; rule, reign
drink or eat (thick liquid such as gruel; with sucking sound)
used for counting without reference to any specific object
hard or stiff (of objects), difficult, hard-working (of people)
hide by covering, prevent from being seen
push or hit (as with stick or elbow)
hole in the trunk of a tree
knife (improvised instrument for cutting or carving)
peel (without instrument, as banana or peanut)
send (s.o., or sth. with s.o. else)
used for counting without reference to any specific object
used for counting without reference to any specific object
